name: Babies World
body: A final thesis for my school career. The assignment 'Fertility awareness in Belgium', where we had to make a campaign in groups of two to invent and create the campaign. These where 4 intense weeks of research, design and development| This project was made with Yves-Laurent

name: Christmas Card
body: A fun development assignment for the class Experimental web. Another group project of groups of 2. We had to combine two experimental technologies from a given list and make something, it could literally be anything| The technologies where Service​ ​Workers, Web​ ​Midi, Web​ ​Audio, WebVR, Deep​ ​Learning​ ​/​ ​Machine​ ​Learning, asm.js. This website had a lot of inspiration| So as it was about to be Christmas we made an interactive Christmas card where you could send a message to a loved one by speaking to your computer and adjust the pitch. A fun extra was the Google Speech API where you didn't have to type your message again| This project was made with Louise

name: Zombie Shooter
body: A school assignment for the class Collaborative Development. Here we had to work in groups of 2 to create a PhaserJS game, but there was a twist| Halfway this project we had to switch projects with another group and work on there project. So the Zombie Shooter was our part one and the Snail Game was our part two| Note: Go to the admin page by clicking here

name: Tribute
body: A final for semester 3 where we had to work 3 weeks on this project. Again a group project. Here we where given a few names of popular singers who had passed away. We had to choose one of them and make a tribute website, but not the usual. We had to present them in a way not most people knew them| We chose for Michael Jackson and presented him through his cloting style| This project had it's requirements to, the page must at least have 1500 words, a creative video that fits the page and two interactive React components| This project was made with Yves-Laurent

name: Word Search
body: A little project I got for my internship, there was a webshop with some specific costumizable stuff. So there was also a word search where you could put in your own words| Here I had to make the word search including the change of color and it had to have a chance of overlapping to make it look way nicer| As this is pure the logic I didn't put much effort on the styling

name: MSK Ghent
body: The final of year 2 and the most fun project I worked on. We had to work in groups of 4, 3 Deviners and 1 student of the university of Rotterdam. So we had one week where the other students came to Belgium 1 week where we worked from distance and 1 week where we went to Rotterdam| The project was to attract people to the MSK Museum in Ghent, it had to be accessible for everyone

name: Mapbox
body: First I created a basic page with the tutorial code found on the Mapbox website| After this was done I could create my own map and just change the link of the mapstyle| Last I found the flyTo method, this was just a mather of finding the right coordinates and that’s it!

name: Webpack Boilerplate
body: A home project for when I want to use a basic webpack setup.

name: React Boilerplate
body: A home project for when I want to use a basic React setup with webpack instead of the Create-react-app

name: Snail Game
body: A school assignment for the class Collaborative Development. Here we had to work in groups of 2 to create a PhaserJS game, but there was a twist| Halfway this project we had to switch projects with another group and work on there project. So the Snail Game was second part and the Zombie Shooter was our first one| Note: Go to the admin page by clicking here

name: iPresent
body: A native iOS app for iPhone. Assignment was to present a brand or product, it had a few requirements| It had to have a minimum of 3 screens at least text and video or images| Last was the data, it had to come from a online or offline JSON file

name: Jaspr
body: Another school assignment for the class Motion, we had to pick a kickstarter and make an explainer video for it| This was my result. As i’m not the best at illustrating i’m still happy with the result.
